snippet: Despite the threat of international sanctions after a deadline on Monday, Salva Kiir did not sign the accord aimed at ending fighting in a devastating civil war.
abstract: South Sudan Pres Salva Kiir, defying threats of international sanctions, refuses to sign peace deal to end civil war in country.

byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Despite the threat of international sanctions after a deadline on Monday, Salva Kiir did not sign the accord aimed at ending fighting in a devastating civil war.

headline.main: South Sudan’s President Lets Deadline for Signing a Peace Deal Pass
headline.print_headline: South Sudan’s President Lets Deadline for Signing a Peace Deal Pass
